title: Develop Cardano visuals
description: The current visual styles of the blockchain industry are very similar, making it hard for Cardano to catch attention - unless it stands out!

f6_assessments.q0: $24,000 to create a social media account about Cardano and post 3 times a week for 6 months. The proposal will inform people looking at the page and could result in some onboarding. Money would be better spent sponsoring already popular pages to speak about Cardano and Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1:
It is highly unlikely that with 3 posts a week, this page will generate any sort of following in the first 6 months. Proposal gives no indication of what will happen after exhaustion of funds. It would have been useful to submit a draft 'post' so that voters and CAs can understand the quality of material to be posted.
Co-op with 1-2 illustrators to create editorial content | $3,000*6 months = 18,000
Social media push | $200 per month*6 months= 1,200
Digital Marketing Coordinator | $800*6 months= 4,800

Illustrators are getting $3000 each month for 12/13 posts or 60 images. Not sure why each post will have 5 images instead of consistently posting 1 image at a time. Perhaps proposer can also describe why a digital marketing coordinator is needed and what his job would be for such a small project.

The success revolves around having new people in Cardano and Catalyst. This project has a low chance of attracting a substantial number of users which would justify the price tag. Sponsoring existing pages seems more efficient and effective.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no way that was described that can somehow link new registrant on ideascale (and later proposals they submit) to social accounts created through this proposal. It makes the project a leap of faith, and a costly one at 24% of challenge funds.

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
Yes. All crypto visuals look alike so Cardano finds it hard to stand out among the bigger coins..


Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
 Yes

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Yes. Creating unique and fresh graphics will benefit the system 
 

Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
No. Only number of posts and images have been stated. For a visually intensive project like this more metrics are needed.
 
Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Only output metrics are stated. ie No of posts, images per post etc. Metrics like how many views, how many likes, how many members on the FB page or Insta profile, how many clicks on elements within the post to take them to an online form or other resources.
 

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes if a proper and detailed proposal is done.
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
 No links or team members are given

Are these links sufficient?
 No

 
Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
None to visit 


Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
No 

Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
His team would be 2 illustrators and a DM coordinator 

Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
Yes



Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
Yes
 

IS budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
somewhat 

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
No aditional plan is given 

Have you verified this plan?
No 


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
 Yes


Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
 No


Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
Resources are broadly described 
 


Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
No technical details are given 

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
No
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
No roadmap or milestones beyond saying this will take 6 months and will be done at the rate of 3 posts per week.



Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
No.. Only post numbers are given. No clicks, likes, views, shares, no of those joining, or numbers of those becoming proposers. If these were given plan would be more complete
 

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes
 

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes
 

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
No

 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
No plan given
 

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
No

f6_assessments.q0:
from the proposal, it was unclear what social media they plan to use - 

twitter
ig
yt
dedicated webpage?

in all of these, it is very hard to point out, and thus, the efficiency might not be as large as expected. 

Also, I would like to see a more specific proposal, so it could be evaluated better. But from the text I can read right now, it sounds as:

we create an IG account, and we will post eye-catch pictures. 

In this field, there is a large competition, also, more proposers have similar ideas with spreading news, and many of them will be eventually left behind. To do it right, a team is required (recomennded), with a well-designed plan. 

Nevertheless, such a proposal as this one can serve to complete one of the tasks required to have such a media.
f6_assessments.q1:
no link provided
a description is stated - seems sufficient
examples were attached - approved. 

in the text, the proposer uses "we", so it would be nice to see who is "we", at least key members.
f6_assessments.q2: we can measure the number of views, likes, interactions, but it would be hard to measure how many people were new, and therefore the proposer outreach has increased.

solution: We aim to develop an educational social media account with a fresh graphic style to deliver a more unique image of the Cardano brand.
experience: The project lead has over six years in marketing and PR. Previously for a large PR agency in charge of social accounts for global brands.
